title: 103_hr4806
content: The Act titled "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1994" defines its short title as the "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1994". The "1994 Institutions" referred to in the Act include various colleges such as Bay Mills Community College, Blackfeet Community College, Cheyenne River Community College, D-Q University, and others. The Act includes colleges like Sisseton Wahpeton Community College, Standing Rock College, Stonechild Community College, Turtle Mountain Community College, Navajo Community College, United Tribes Technical College, Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development, Crownpoint Institute of Technology, Haskell Indian Junior College, Leech Lake Tribal College, and College of the Menominee Nation. SEC. 3. LAND-GRANT STATUS FOR 1994 INSTITUTIONS. SEC. 3. LAND-GRANT STATUS FOR 1994 INSTITUTIONS. 1994 Institutions are considered land-grant colleges for agriculture and mechanic arts under the Act of July 2, 1862. An authorization of $23,000,000 is granted to establish an endowment for 1994 Institutions. The Secretary of the Treasury will establish a 1994 Institutions Endowment Fund, depositing appropriations and interest into it. The fund will be invested in US interest-bearing obligations, with withdrawals and expenditures subject to restrictions. The Secretary establishes a 1994 Institutions Endowment Fund, with withdrawals and expenditures restricted. Income is distributed among 1994 Institutions based on Indian student count. The Education Act allocates 40 percent of adjusted income to be distributed equally among 1994 Institutions. SEC. 4. APPROPRIATIONS. Authorization of Appropriations for 1994 Institutions under the Department of the Treasury is specified, with an amount to be appropriated based on the number of institutions. The funds are to be used in accordance with regulations for colleges under the Act of August 30, 1890. The Act of May 8, 1914 authorizes appropriations for 1994 Institutions, with $5,000,000 allocated annually for their purposes. These funds are in addition to those provided for other states and territories. The Act of May 8, 1914 authorizes annual appropriations of $5,000,000 for 1994 Institutions without a matching requirement for funds under subsection (b)(3). SEC. 5. INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY BUILDING GRANTS. In this section, the definitions of "Federal share," "non-Federal share," and "Secretary" are provided. The Secretary of Agriculture will make institutional capacity building grants to assist 1994 Institutions with constructing, acquiring, and remodeling buildings, laboratories, and other capital facilities for fiscal years 1995 through 1999. The Secretary will make grants for 1994 Institutions to improve research facilities in agriculture and sciences through a competitive application process ensuring geographic diversity. Applicants must demonstrate need to receive a grant. The Secretary may award a grant to an applicant demonstrating a failure to secure project funding after reasonable efforts. The recipient must pay a specified non-Federal share for the grant. $1,700,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 1995 to 1999 for the Department of Agriculture to implement this section.
